key_myths.title: Divine Birth and Family Tragedy
key_myths.summary: • Erlang Shen (Yang Jian) was born from the union of a mortal man, Yang Tianyou, and the Jade Emperor's sister, the goddess Yaoji. This forbidden marriage enraged the Jade Emperor, who imprisoned Yaoji beneath Mount Tao. Young Erlang Shen eventually grew powerful enough to cleave the mountain with his axe and free his mother, only to witness her die from the Jade Emperor's punishment.

key_myths.title: Splitting the Mountain
key_myths.summary: • The tale of Erlang Shen splitting Mount Tao to save his mother (or in some versions, Mount Hua) became one of the most beloved stories in Chinese folklore, symbolizing filial devotion and the willingness to defy heaven itself for family. This story inspired later tales of similar heroic rescues.

key_myths.title: Taming the Floods
key_myths.summary: • In some traditions, Erlang Shen is credited with controlling devastating floods by channeling rivers and defeating water demons. He is associated with the ancient flood-control hero Li Bing of Sichuan and worshipped at Guankou (Dujiangyan), where he is believed to protect against flooding.

key_myths.title: Battle with Sun Wukong
key_myths.summary: • In Journey to the West, when all other celestial warriors failed to capture the rebellious Monkey King, Erlang Shen was dispatched. The two engaged in an epic battle of transformations - Sun Wukong transformed into a sparrow, Erlang became a hawk; the monkey became a fish, the god became a cormorant. Erlang Shen's third eye could see through each disguise, making him the only warrior who could match Sun Wukong in combat.

key_myths.title: The War Against the Shang
key_myths.summary: • In the Fengshen Yanyi, Yang Jian serves as one of the greatest generals in the campaign to overthrow the tyrannical King Zhou. He battles numerous powerful demons and sorcerers, using his transformations and combat skills to turn the tide of many battles.

key_myths.title: Conflict with the Jade Emperor
key_myths.summary: • Despite being the Jade Emperor's nephew, Erlang Shen maintains a complicated relationship with heaven. He often acts independently, is said to "listen to the celestial decrees but not the celestial summons" (å¬è°ƒä¸å¬å®£), and dwells at Guankou rather than in the celestial court. This independence reflects his resentment over his mother's fate.

archetype.description: Erlang Shen embodies the Divine Warrior archetype - celestial champion who hunts evil, possesses supernatural sight, and stands between humanity and demonic forces.
